resources.string:
This guide will help you set-up your new aquarium!

The following pages will give a list of recommended items to buy, provide tools to help calculate dosage amounts and configure extra items.

If you prefer, you may skip the guide and enter these details manually by pressing the "Skip" button below. Otherwise, choose "Continue", or swipe to the right.

This is a list of essential and optional items required for setting up a new aquarium.\n\nIt is possible to continue without some of the \"Essential\" items, but they are included because of their usefulness.

To calculate the correct dosage of ammonia for an aquarium, it is first necessary to know its volume.

If your aquarium is a traditional box shape, enter its height, width and length below to calculate its volume.

If you already know the volume of your aquarium, then you may enter it directly.

The dosage amount for your aquarium is based on its volume, the amount of pure ammonia in your ammonia source, and what overall concentration of ammonia you would like. 

The volume of your aquarium was calculated on the last slide. Enter the amount of pure ammonia in your ammonia source, and desired final concentration, below.

Most cleaning products that use ammonia contain around 10% pure ammonia. 3 ppm or mg/L is the recommended concentration of ammonia for your aquarium during the fishless cycle.

Place your aquarium in its final location. This should be on a stable, level surface away from direct sunlight.

Aquariums can be very heavy once filled with water. Direct sunlight can encourage algae growth, particularly whilst a tank is cycling, so it is best avoided.

If your tank includes a heater, plants or seed material, then check the corresponding boxes below.
An aquarium can be considered heavily planted if less than a quarter of its substrate is visible when viewed from above.

Use your water softener to prepare %1$d %2$s of dechlorinated tap water, and add it to your aquarium. Turn on your aquarium's filter%3$s.

Follow the instructions on your water testing kit to get the ammonia, nitrite and nitrate values of your dechlorinated tap water. Enter these numbers into the Control Reading boxes.

Add %4$sml of ammonia solution to your aquarium, wait for an hour, then conduct a second reading. Add these values to the First Reading boxes.
